bugs.title: CVE-2022-30974 mujs: stack consumption because of unlimited recursion in compile() in regexp.c [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-30974 mujs: stack consumption because of unlimited recursion in compile() in regexp.c [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-30974 mujs: stack consumption because of unlimited recursion in compile() in regexp.c

long_desc.thetext:
compile in regexp.c in Artifex MuJS through 1.2.0 results in stack consumption because of unlimited recursion, a different issue than CVE-2019-11413.

Reference:
https://github.com/ccxvii/mujs/issues/162

Created mujs tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2088591]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2088590]


Created mupdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2088592]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-8.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

bugs.title: CVE-2022-30975 mujs: NULL pointer dereference in jsP_dumpsyntax() in jsdump.c [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-30975 mujs: NULL pointer dereference in jsP_dumpsyntax() in jsdump.c [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-30975 mujs: NULL pointer dereference in jsP_dumpsyntax() in jsdump.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Artifex MuJS through 1.2.0, jsP_dumpsyntax in jsdump.c has a NULL pointer dereference, as demonstrated by mujs-pp.

Reference:
https://github.com/ccxvii/mujs/issues/161

Created mujs tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2088596]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2088594]


Created mupdf tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2022-44789 mujs: use-after-free in O_getOwnPropertyDescriptor() in jsobject.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-44789 mujs: use-after-free in O_getOwnPropertyDescriptor() in jsobject.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-44789 mujs: use-after-free in O_getOwnPropertyDescriptor() in jsobject.c

long_desc.thetext:
A logical issue in O_getOwnPropertyDescriptor() in Artifex MuJS 1.0.0 through 1.3.1 allows an attacker to achieve Remote Code Execution through memory corruption, via the loading of a crafted JavaScript file.

Reference:
https://github.com/alalng/CVE-2022-44789/blob/main/PublicReferenceURL.txt

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/ccxvii/mujs/commit/edb50ad66f7601ca9a3544a0e9045e8a8c60561f

Created mujs tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2148260]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2148261]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2148245
